revised_title: Electron Microscopy of Somatic Sensory Cortex: Cell Types and Synaptic Organization
tldr: This study examines the somatic sensory cortex of the cat using electron microscopy to identify and analyze the cell types and synaptic organization. Two main types of neurons, pyramidal and non-pyramidal, are distinguished based on their structure and function. The research also explores the synaptic relationships between these neurons and the different types of axon terminals, providing insights into the functional implications of these connections.
